body:
some more info: dumping responses shows the problem:

POST /api/v1/file/access.json

yields response

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Language: en
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Date: Sat, 22 Jan 2022 04:16:23 GMT
Expires: 0
Last-Modified: Sat, 22 Jan 2022 04:16:23 GMT
Server: openresty
Serverid: s8
X-Powered-By: OpenDrive.com

533
{"FileId":"<blabla>","Name":"<bigname>","GroupID":0,"Extension":"","Size":"<size>","Views":"0","Downloads":"0","DateModified":"<timestamp>","Access":"0","Link":"<omitted>","DownloadLink":"<omitted>","StreamingLink":"<omitted>","TempStreamingLink":"<omitted>","Encrypted":0,"Password":"","Description":"","DirUpdateTime":<timestamp>}
0
```

but the the subsequent `GET /api/v1/folder/itembyname.json/<session_id>/<account>?name=<name>` yields only
```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Language: en
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Date: Sat, 22 Jan 2022 04:16:23 GMT
Expires: 0
Last-Modified: Sat, 22 Jan 2022 04:16:23 GMT
Server: openresty
Serverid: s8
X-Powered-By: OpenDrive.com

1e
{"DirUpdateTime":"<timestamp>"}
0
```

the call to access is followed by a read of metadata, problem is this section
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/c504d970174a604a39fdb2b2d1c51f2ca34ab31d/backend/opendrive/opendrive.go#L1030-L1046

folderList is never filled by the call because only `DirUpdateTime` is returned. 

I've discovered I can copy only very small files (a few kb). Anything over a few dozen mb fails. Do any of the other backends have a similar issue? What is the resolution pattern here

decreasing the size of the chunks by modifying the data section of rconf to 
```
[data]
type = chunker
remote opendrivecrypt
chunksize = 50Mi
```

Also does not help

played around with retries and timeouts but discovered a larger issue: looking at the api doc on this page: https://www.opendrive.com/api the endpoint we use for metadata finding `/folder/itembyname.json/{session_id}/{folder_id}` is supposed to only ever return `DirUpdateTime`. However, the actual response (sometimes) includes an additional undocumented field (`Files`) that rclone assumes exist for the purposes of validating an object Update. 

When running with a very small file I get the following response:

```
GET /api/v1/folder/itembyname.json/<session_id>/<folder_id>?name=<name> 

{
	"DirUpdateTime": "",
	"Files": [{
		"FileId": "",
		"Name": "",
		"GroupID": 0,
		"Extension": "",
		"Size": "",
		"Views": "",
		"Version": "",
		"Downloads": "",
		"DateModified": "",
		"Access": "",
		"Link": "",
		"DownloadLink": "",
		"StreamingLink": "",
		"TempStreamingLink": "",
		"ThumbLink": "",
		"Encrypted": 0,
		"Password": "",
	}]
}
```

Larger files seem to take an arbitrary amount of time before they appear in the `itembyname` endpoint, but they DO exist, and can be seen by calling `/api/v1/file/info.json/<file_id>?session_id=<session_id>` immediately 

Patching `readMetaData` partially fixes the issue. Insert the following to fetch the object directly if you know the id before calling the other endpoint:
https://github.com/scott-grimes/rclone/pull/1/files

With this patch in place I can now upload files consistently, and the logs also show hash checks which they did not before since no has was returned by the other endpoint ðŸŽ‰ 

Unfortunately this introduces another problem: only files less than `chunksize` work when copying. If you attempt to copy a file larger than your chunksize you get this:

```
INFO  : myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.001_5fnp4y: Moved (server-side) to: myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.001
INFO  : myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.002_5fnp4y: Moved (server-side) to: myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.002
INFO  : myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.003_5fnp4y: Moved (server-side) to: myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.003
INFO  : myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.004_5fnp4y: Moved (server-side) to: myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.004
INFO  : myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.005_5fnp4y: Moved (server-side) to: myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.005
DEBUG : <fileid>: Uploading chunk 0, size=127, remain=0
DEBUG : myfile.dat: md5 = <incorrectsha> OK
INFO  : myfile.dat: Copied (replaced existing)
INFO  : 
Transferred:   	  419.480 MiB / 419.480 MiB, 100%, 2.324 MiB/s, ETA 0s
Checks:                 5 / 5, 100%
Renamed:                5
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:      4m54.7s

2022/01/22 23:17:41 DEBUG : 5 go routines active
...
$ rclone ls <remotefolder>
       79 myfile.dat
$ rclone cat <remotefolder>/myfile.dat
{"ver":1,"size":219901614,"nchunks":5,"md5":"<correctsha>"}
$ rclone ls opendrivecrypt:
79 myfie.dat
```

something is weird with the naming of the files, there are no `myfie.dat.rclone_chunk.001`, etc files, it's like each chunk is getting incorrectly named as the primary file, and the final upload of metadata overwrites them all

looking at the raw directory it looks like the chunk files do actually exist: in fact there are multiple copies of the file there! 

apparently names do not need to be unique per directory? I added calls `/file/path.json/" + f.session.SessionID + "/" + srcObj.id` before and after the `/file/move_copy.json` and can verify that the chunk files do correctly get moved. 

```
$ rclone ls <dir_encrypted> | sort | uniq -c | sort
...
1  52441632 <dir_encrypted>/<filename_encrypted_0>
1  52441632 <dir_encrypted>/<filename_encrypted_1>
1  52441632 <dir_encrypted>/<filename_encrypted_2>
1  52441632 <dir_encrypted>/<filename_encrypted_3>
1  52441632 <dir_encrypted>/<filename_encrypted_4>
8  52441632 <dir_encrypted>/<filename_encrypted_5>
8  10188942 <dir_encrypted>/<filename_encrypted_6>
8  52441632 <dir_encrypted>/<filename_encrypted_7>
8  52441632 <dir_encrypted>/<filename_encrypted_8>
8  52441632 <dir_encrypted>/<filename_encrypted_9>
```

it looks like maybe theres a problem with the file names themselves?

if I run the raw name of one of the chungks through `rclone cryptdecode <backend> <encryptedfilename>` I get `Failed to decrypt`. 

Computing the expected encrypted name gives me a result that does not match what exists in the backend: 

```
rclone ls opendrivebase: | grep $(rclone cryptdecode opendrivecrypt: "myfile.dat.rclone_chunk.002" --reverse | awk '{print $2}')
# nothing
rclone ls opendrivebase: | grep $(rclone cryptdecode opendrivecrypt: "somefilethatIknowexists" --reverse | awk '{print $2}')
13912 data/<directory>/<encryptedfilename>
```

solved. 

opendrive silently truncates long filenames but only during a `move_copy` operation. attempting the following will fail:
```
rclone mkdir <base>:<giant_dir_name>
ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: failed to make directory: Invalid value specified for `folder_name`. Maximum 255 characters allowed. (Error 400)

rclone touch <base>:<giant_file_name>
ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: failed to touch (create): failed to make directory: Invalid value specified for `folder_name`. Maximum 255 characters allowed. (Error 400)
```

but if you craft a call to POST /file/move_copy.json with
```
{
	"session_id": "<session_id>",
	"src_file_id": "<src_file_id>",
	"dst_folder_id": "<dest_folder_id>",
	"move": true,
	"overwrite_if_exists": true,
	"new_file_name": "<anything longer than 255 char>"
}
```
you get back 
```
 200 OK
 {
  "FileId": "<src_file_id>",
  "Name": "<truncated name to 255 chars>",
  ...
}
```

ðŸ™„

issue.title: opendrive compatibility - #5936

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?
Resolves two issues:
1) fetches metadata directly from `/file/info.json` in readMetaData when possible (if the object id is already known)

Previously all calls in readMetaData relied on the `/folder/itembyname.json` api which is buggy: items written to a directory take an arbitrary amount of time to appear via this endpoint, and the file info returned does not include the file hash

2) resolves an undocumented feature of the `move_copy` endpoint which silently truncates new filenames to 255 char. 

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/5936

#### Checklist

- [X] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [X] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

issue.title: opendrive: resolve lag and truncate bugs fixes #5936

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?
Resolves two issues with opendrive:
1) fetches metadata directly from `/file/info.json` in readMetaData when possible (if the object id is already known)

Previously all calls in readMetaData relied on the `/folder/itembyname.json` api which is buggy: items written to a directory take an arbitrary amount of time to appear via this endpoint, and the file info returned does not include the file hash.

2) resolves a bug caused by an undocumented feature of the `move_copy` endpoint which silently truncates new filenames to 255 char. rclone (correctly) throws an error when attempting to create a file or directory that surpasses the max length for opendrive, but there is no check performed in the move_copy command. Without such a check files written to the remote may have their names modified unknowingly. 

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/5936

#### Checklist

- [X] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [X] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
